Key Match Events: Jon Thorsteinsson scored the opening goal for Iceland on 12 minutes.
Aaron Ramsdale made an error in goal allowing Thorsteinsson to score.
John Stones had to be substituted at halftime due to injury concerns.
Pre-Game Insights: GRAEME SOUNNESS believes England is the favorite to win Euro 2024.
Gareth Southgate is confident his team will improve against Serbia.
Wayne Rooney claims England missed Harry Maguire in their defense.
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate acknowledges the performance was disjointed and disappointing but sees it as good for the team before an international tournament.
England fans booed the team at full-time.
Southgate highlights the need to be better without the ball and looks at learning opportunities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a friendly at Wembley Stadium.
Iceland's goal was the first in 70 years for England in this fixture.
England had only one shot on target, while Iceland had four.
Others: The match was the final warm-up before Euro 2024.
Harry Kane expressed confidence in the team despite the loss.
